Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it correctly in their illustration.
The student can include and label the location where the fish lives, such as a pond, river, lake, or ocean.
The student can illustrate and label the water as an essential resource needed by the fish to swim and survive.
The student can depict and label other elements of the fish's habitat, such as plants or rocks, to show what the environment provides.
The student can illustrate and explain through labels how the fish relates to its surroundings (e.g., swimming in water or hiding among plants).
The student can label and describe, through their drawing, how all parts of the fish's environment work together to meet its needs.
